text: [Music]
hello my name is Michelle Kos and I'm a
professor in the department of genetics
at Stanford Medical School and I'd like
to introduce right now a course on stem
cell Therapeutics we want to let you
know kind of what stem cells are and how
these can be used as
Therapeutics in addition to talking
about these things in lectures we've
also got some laboratory segments for
you and these are starring a couple of
postdocs from my laboratory and you'll
see them doing some of these procedures
so really this class is for those that
want to uh get an overview of what stem
cells are how they're being used today
to develop Therapeutics on one hand
you'll see lectures by experts in the
field who are pioneering the frontiers
of stem cell Therapeutics and then
you're also going to see some
researchers carrying out some of these
methods and procedures in the laboratory
so you can understand what actually goes
on to make these therapies happen by the
time you finish going through this
course you should be pretty up to dat on
the current stem cell approaches and it
should put you in a position to follow
the future developments and evaluate
them as the science and the clinical
approaches mature in this fast moving
[Music]
field
